name: BRAIN TUMOR / INFECTION
indications: Indicated for the detection, characterization, and follow-up of brain tumors or suspected infections. Contrast helps to visualize abnormal tissue and inflammation.
contrast_rationale: Tumors and areas of infection often disrupt the blood-brain barrier, causing contrast to accumulate and 'enhance'. This helps delineate tumor margins, distinguish abscesses from solid masses, and assess for disease activity.

name: BRAIN MS
indications: Specifically designed to detect and monitor the characteristic lesions of Multiple Sclerosis. Contrast is used to identify active areas of inflammation.
contrast_rationale: In Multiple Sclerosis, active inflammation causes a temporary breakdown of the blood-brain barrier. Enhancing lesions indicate active disease, helping to distinguish new from old plaques and monitor treatment effectiveness.

name: PITUITARY
indications: For evaluating pituitary gland abnormalities, such as adenomas, often related to hormonal imbalances. Dynamic contrast helps differentiate small tumors from normal gland tissue.
contrast_rationale: The normal pituitary gland enhances rapidly, while adenomas enhance more slowly. Dynamic imaging captures this difference, making even small microadenomas visible against the intensely enhancing normal gland.

contraindications.pregnancy_considerations: Generally avoided due to gadolinium contrast injection and radiation exposure during fluoroscopic guidance

common_pitfalls: Inadequate contrast filling of joint capsule
Patient movement between injection and imaging
Delayed imaging allowing contrast to leak out
Inadequate fat suppression obscuring labral tears
Motion artifact from patient discomfort post-injection

sequence_rationale.purpose: Anatomic overview and assessment of contrast distribution within joint
sequence_rationale.key_findings: Joint capsule distension, overall hip anatomy, bone marrow signal

sequence_rationale.purpose: Fat-suppressed sequences to highlight intra-articular contrast
sequence_rationale.key_findings: Acetabular labral tears, cartilage defects, loose bodies, capsular abnormalities

clinical_pearls: Optimal imaging should occur within 30-45 minutes of contrast injection
Fat suppression is critical for detecting labral tears outlined by contrast
Coronal oblique planes parallel to femoral neck provide best labral visualization
Normal labrum appears as low signal triangular structure on all sequences
Contrast extending into labral substance indicates tear
when_to_upgrade: Add STIR sequences if fat suppression is inadequate
Consider additional oblique planes for complex labral anatomy
Add post-contrast sequences if infection suspected
when_to_downgrade: Standard hip MRI without arthrogram if patient cannot tolerate injection
Consider CT arthrogram if MRI contraindicated

alternative_protocols.when_to_use: When injection contraindicated or patient refuses procedure
MRI contraindicated but arthrographic evaluation still needed

enrichment.coil_selection: Phased array body coil or dedicated hip coil

patient_positioning.special_considerations: Hip in slight internal rotation, comfortable positioning to minimize movement post-injection

supported_indications: No specific ACR criteria provided for hip arthrogram in given context
acr_alignment.rating_notes: Provided ACR context covers hand/wrist pain, not hip pathology. Hip MR arthrography is generally considered appropriate for labral tear evaluation.

references: ACR Appropriateness Criteria would typically include musculoskeletal hip pain scenarios

name: OSTEOMYELITIS
indications: Evaluation of suspected bone infection (osteomyelitis). Contrast is essential for assessing extent of infection, abscess formation, and soft tissue involvement. Used for diabetic foot infections, post-surgical infections, and hematogenous osteomyelitis.
contrast_rationale: Contrast enhancement is critical for differentiating infection from reactive edema, identifying abscess collections, assessing soft tissue extension, and evaluating for sinus tracts. Post-contrast fat-saturated T1 sequences are the most sensitive for detecting enhancement patterns characteristic of infection.
scanner_notes: FOV should cover entire region of clinical concern plus margin
Ensure adequate fat suppression on post-contrast sequences
Consider adding STIR if fat suppression is suboptimal
